newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong unit trusts net inflows at record levels.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong unit trusts net inflows at record levels.

text.p: The Hong Kong Investment Funds Association (HKIFA) said on Thursday the industry registered aggregate net inflows of US$761.81 million in the first nine months of 1996, the highest level since 1989.
Gross sales reached US$3.49 billion, the HKIFA said in a statement.
Compared to the same period last year, gross sales increased 45.8 percent while net sales rose almost eight times, it said.
HKIFA chairman Andrew Lo said strong sales came on positive investment sentiment as U.S. economic growth appears benign and the U.S. Federal Reserve has refrained from raising rates.
In September, net inflows reached US$134.04 million, leaving the gross to net ratio at approximately three to one, the HKIFA said.
Asia-Pacific regional (ex-Japan and Hong Kong) funds attracted the highest net inflows with 30.4 percent of the total, despite having been lacklustre in most other months.
The association represents 45 fund companies as full members and 34 professional firms, which include trustees, accountants and lawyers, as associate members.
